title: General Theory of Markov Processes
description:
From the preface 
This work is intended to serve as a reference to the theory of right 
processes, a very general class of right continuous strong Markov processes. 
The use of the term general theory is meant to suggest both the absence of 
hypotheses of special type other than those for right processes, and the coordination 
of the methods with those of the general theory of processes, as 
exposed in the first two volumes of Probabilites et Potentiel by Dellacherie 
and Meyer. We do provide in the appendix a fairly extensive discussion 
and summary of the general techniques needed in the text, with hopes that 
it may lead the reader to a fuller appreciation of the Dellacherie-Meyer 
volumes...
